Textbook: Terribly formatted. Terminology described 3-4 paragraphs down but used numerously beforehand. Gathering information from this textbook is like solving sudoku.  

Lecture: Don't go he will read his terribly formatted slides in a way that makes you think he has never seen them  before in his life

It is an easy class though so take it

Given the poor reviews, I guess he changed his style. I didnt go to a single lecture and got an A+. Just read his personalized textbook, and its not a traditional textbook. 15 ish pages per chapter. 9 chapters. Can read the whole thing in a day. Just takes a couple pages of notes per chapter, memorize it and you will succeed. GPA booster no doubt

The worst ever professor I have ever had in my entire degree. I have been a student for 7 years at SFU, pursuing a double degree in Business and Biomedical Physiology! I've had my share of good and bad professors, but this one was by far the worst. I have never rated any of my other profs, but this one was so bad, that students need to stop taking

311 with Amandio wasn't especially difficult, since we had no textbook the exams are straight from his slides. Lectures are extremely boring and he often goes on tangents that are unrelated to what will be tested, however he often drops hints in class on what questions he will ask on the midterm and final. Presentation for this class was easy.

The Canvas modules he made were horrible... little information on them and basically told us to read the (massive) textbook chapters. He was not available for help via emails and wouldn't give specifics for anything and just said to read the textbook again. The average for the midterm was 42% and the highest mark was 76% so AVOID!

The material is very interesting, but research presented in class is dated and drags out a lecture that could be finished in half the time. Tests were based on minute details. Not too hard to study for, but requires some patience. No textbook.
